channel.title: Poem of The Day
channel.description: A daily dose of poetry to enrich your day. Please send suggested readings to poem@sonibyte.com. Powered by SoniByte.
channel.itunes:subtitle: A daily dose of poetry
channel.itunes:author: SoniByte
channel.itunes:summary: A daily dose of poetry to enrich your day. Please send suggested readings to poem@sonibyte.com. Powered by SoniByte.

item.title: The Castle
item.itunes:author: Edwin Muir
item.itunes:summary:
The Castle by Edwin Muir
"All through that summer at ease we lay, And daily from the turret wall We watched the mowers in the hay And the enemy half a mile away They seemed no threat to us at all"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Edwin Muir
item.description:
The Castle by Edwin Muir
"All through that summer at ease we lay, And daily from the turret wall We watched the mowers in the hay And the enemy half a mile away They seemed no threat to us at all"...

item.title: Her breast is fit for pearls
item.itunes:author: Emily Dickinson
item.itunes:summary:
Her breast is fit for pearls by Emily Dickinson
"Her breast is fit for pearls, But I was not a "Diver" -- Her brow is fit for thrones But I have not a crest. Her heart is fit for home -- I -- a Sparrow -- build there Sweet of twigs and twine My perennial nest."
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Emily Dickinson
item.description:
Her breast is fit for pearls by Emily Dickinson
"Her breast is fit for pearls, But I was not a "Diver" -- Her brow is fit for thrones But I have not a crest. Her heart is fit for home -- I -- a Sparrow -- build there Sweet of twigs and twine My perennial nest."

item.title: Laughing Rose
item.itunes:author: William Henry Davies
item.itunes:summary:
Laughing Rose by William Henry Davies
"If I were gusty April now, How I would blow at laughing Rose; I'd make her ribbons slip their knots, And all her hair come loose"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, William Henry Davies
item.description:
Laughing Rose by William Henry Davies
"If I were gusty April now, How I would blow at laughing Rose; I'd make her ribbons slip their knots, And all her hair come loose"...

item.title: Alone
item.itunes:author: Maya Angelou
item.itunes:summary:
Alone by Maya Angelou
"Lying, thinking Last night How to find my soul a home Where water is not thirsty And bread loaf is not stone I came up with one thing And I don't believe I'm wrong That nobody, But nobody Can make it out here alone"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Maya Angelou
item.description:
Alone by Maya Angelou
"Lying, thinking Last night How to find my soul a home Where water is not thirsty And bread loaf is not stone I came up with one thing And I don't believe I'm wrong That nobody, But nobody Can make it out here alone"...

item.title: Autumn Fires
item.itunes:author: Robert Louis Stevenson
item.itunes:summary:
Autumn Fires by Robert Louis Stevenson
"In the other gardens And all up the vale, From the autumn bonfires See the smoke trail"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description:
Autumn Fires by Robert Louis Stevenson
"In the other gardens And all up the vale, From the autumn bonfires See the smoke trail"...

item.title: In Time Of Silver Rain
item.itunes:author: Langston Hughes
item.itunes:summary:
In Time Of Silver Rain by Langston Hughes
"In time of silver rain The earth puts forth new life again, Green grasses grow And flowers lift their heads, And over all the plain The wonder spreads"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Langston Hughes
item.description:
In Time Of Silver Rain by Langston Hughes
"In time of silver rain The earth puts forth new life again, Green grasses grow And flowers lift their heads, And over all the plain The wonder spreads"...

item.title: Nightfall
item.itunes:author: Marietta Holley
item.itunes:summary:
Nightfall by Marietta Holley
"Soft o'er the meadow, and murmuring mere, Falleth a shadow, near and more near; Day like a white dove floats down the sky, Cometh the night, love, darkness is nigh"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Marietta Holley
item.description:
Nightfall by Marietta Holley
"Soft o'er the meadow, and murmuring mere, Falleth a shadow, near and more near; Day like a white dove floats down the sky, Cometh the night, love, darkness is nigh"...

item.title: In The Forest
item.itunes:author: Oscar Wilde
item.itunes:summary:
In The Forest by Oscar Wilde
"Out of the mid-wood's twilight Into the meadow's dawn, Ivory limbed and brown-eyed, Flashes my Faun"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Oscar Wilde
item.description:
In The Forest by Oscar Wilde
"Out of the mid-wood's twilight Into the meadow's dawn, Ivory limbed and brown-eyed, Flashes my Faun"...

item.title: Let Evening Come
item.itunes:author: Jane Kenyon
item.itunes:summary:
Let Evening Come by Jane Kenyon
" Let the light of late afternoon shine through chinks in the barn, moving up the bales as the sun moves down"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Jane Kenyon
item.description:
Let Evening Come by Jane Kenyon
" Let the light of late afternoon shine through chinks in the barn, moving up the bales as the sun moves down"...

item.title: The Twilight Turns
item.itunes:author: James Joyce
item.itunes:summary:
The Twilight Turns by James Joyce
"The twilight turns from amethyst To deep and deeper blue, The lamp fills with a pale green glow The trees of the avenue"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, James Joyce
item.description:
The Twilight Turns by James Joyce
"The twilight turns from amethyst To deep and deeper blue, The lamp fills with a pale green glow The trees of the avenue"...

item.title: Green Rain
item.itunes:author: Mary Webb
item.itunes:summary:
Green Rain by Mary Webb
"Into the scented woods we'll go And see the blackthorn swim in snow. High above, in the budding leaves, A brooding dove awakes and grieves"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Mary Webb
item.description:
Green Rain by Mary Webb
"Into the scented woods we'll go And see the blackthorn swim in snow. High above, in the budding leaves, A brooding dove awakes and grieves"...

item.title: The Rambler
item.itunes:author: Thomas Hardy
item.itunes:summary:
The Rambler by Thomas Hardy
"I do not see the hills around, Nor mark the tints the copses wear; I do not note the grassy ground And constellated daisies there"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Thomas Hardy
item.description:
The Rambler by Thomas Hardy
"I do not see the hills around, Nor mark the tints the copses wear; I do not note the grassy ground And constellated daisies there"...

item.title: The Retreat
item.itunes:author: Charles Bukowski
item.itunes:summary:
The Retreat by Charles Bukowski
"this time has finished me. I feel like the German troops whipped by snow and the communists walking bent with newspapers stuffed into worn boots"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Charles Bukowski
item.description:
The Retreat by Charles Bukowski
"this time has finished me. I feel like the German troops whipped by snow and the communists walking bent with newspapers stuffed into worn boots"...

item.title: The Minstrel?s Grave
item.itunes:author: Frances Anne Kemble
item.itunes:summary:
The Minstrel?s Grave by Frances Anne Kemble
"Oh let it be where the waters are meeting, In one crystal sheet, like the summer's sky bright! Oh let it be where the sun, when retreating, May throw the last glance of his vanishing light"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Frances Anne Kemble
item.description:
The Minstrel?s Grave by Frances Anne Kemble
"Oh let it be where the waters are meeting, In one crystal sheet, like the summer's sky bright! Oh let it be where the sun, when retreating, May throw the last glance of his vanishing light"...

item.title: My Daughter and Apple Pie
item.itunes:author: Raymond Carver
item.itunes:summary:
My Daughter and Apple Pie by Raymond Carver
"She serves me a piece of it a few minutes out of the oven. A little steam rises from the slits on top. Sugar and spice - cinnamon - burned into the crust"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Raymond Carver
item.description:
My Daughter and Apple Pie by Raymond Carver
"She serves me a piece of it a few minutes out of the oven. A little steam rises from the slits on top. Sugar and spice - cinnamon - burned into the crust"...

item.title: The Crescent Moon
item.itunes:author: Amy Lowell
item.itunes:summary:
The Crescent Moon by Amy Lowell
"Slipping softly through the sky Little horned, happy moon, Can you hear me up so high? Will you come down soon"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Amy Lowell
item.description:
The Crescent Moon by Amy Lowell
"Slipping softly through the sky Little horned, happy moon, Can you hear me up so high? Will you come down soon"...

item.title: Bowery Blues
item.itunes:author: Jack Kerouac
item.itunes:summary:
Bowery Blues by Kerouac Jack
"The story of man Makes me sick Inside, outside, I don't know why Something so conditional And all talk Should hurt me so"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Jack Kerouac
item.description:
Bowery Blues by Kerouac Jack
"The story of man Makes me sick Inside, outside, I don't know why Something so conditional And all talk Should hurt me so"...

item.title: Marriage Bells
item.itunes:author: Emma Lazarus
item.itunes:summary:
Marriage Bells by Emma Lazarus
"Music and silver chimes and sunlit air, Freighted with the scent of honeyed orange-flower; Glad, friendly festal faces everywhere. She, rapt from all in this unearthly hour"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Emma Lazarus
item.description:
Marriage Bells by Emma Lazarus
"Music and silver chimes and sunlit air, Freighted with the scent of honeyed orange-flower; Glad, friendly festal faces everywhere. She, rapt from all in this unearthly hour"...

item.title: Eulalie
item.itunes:author: Edgar Allan Poe
item.itunes:summary:
Eulalie by Edgar Allan Poe
"I dwelt alone In a world of moan, And my soul was a stagnant tide, Till the fair and gentle Eulalie became my blushing bride- Till the yellow-haired young Eulalie became my smiling bride"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Edgar Allan Poe
item.description:
Eulalie by Edgar Allan Poe
"I dwelt alone In a world of moan, And my soul was a stagnant tide, Till the fair and gentle Eulalie became my blushing bride- Till the yellow-haired young Eulalie became my smiling bride"...

item.title: All That's Not Love . . .
item.itunes:author: Alan Seeger
item.itunes:summary:
All That's Not Love . . . by Alan Seeger
"All that's not love is the dearth of my days, The leaves of the volume with rubric unwrit, The temple in times without prayer, without praise, The altar unset and the candle unlit"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Alan Seeger
item.description:
All That's Not Love . . . by Alan Seeger
"All that's not love is the dearth of my days, The leaves of the volume with rubric unwrit, The temple in times without prayer, without praise, The altar unset and the candle unlit"...

item.title: A Song About Singing
item.itunes:author: Anne Reeve Aldrich
item.itunes:summary:
A Song About Singing by Anne Reeve Aldrich
"O nightingale, the poet's bird, A kinsman dear thou art, Who never sings so well as when The rose-thorns bruise his heart"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Anne Reeve Aldrich
item.description:
A Song About Singing by Anne Reeve Aldrich
"O nightingale, the poet's bird, A kinsman dear thou art, Who never sings so well as when The rose-thorns bruise his heart"...

item.title: Carrier Letter
item.itunes:author: Hart Crane
item.itunes:summary:
Carrier Letter by Hart Crane
"My hands have not touched water since your hands, - No; - nor my lips freed laughter since 'farewell"'...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Hart Crane
item.description:
Carrier Letter by Hart Crane
"My hands have not touched water since your hands, - No; - nor my lips freed laughter since 'farewell"'...

item.title: Coda
item.itunes:author: Dorothy Parker
item.itunes:summary:
Coda by Dorothy Parker
"There's little in taking or giving, There's little in water or wine; This living, this living, this living Was never a project of mine"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Dorothy Parker
item.description:
Coda by Dorothy Parker
"There's little in taking or giving, There's little in water or wine; This living, this living, this living Was never a project of mine"...

item.title: Rapids
item.itunes:author: A. R. Ammons
item.itunes:summary:
Rapids by A. R. Ammons
"Fall's leaves are redder than spring's flowers, have no pollen, and also sometimes fly, as the wind"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, A. R. Ammons
item.description:
Rapids by A. R. Ammons
"Fall's leaves are redder than spring's flowers, have no pollen, and also sometimes fly, as the wind"...

item.title: Yes And No
item.itunes:author: Laura Riding Jackson
item.itunes:summary:
Yes And No by Laura Riding Jackson
"Across a continent imaginary Because it cannot be discovered now Upon this fully apprehended planet? No more applicants considered, Alas, alas"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Laura Riding Jackson
item.description:
Yes And No by Laura Riding Jackson
"Across a continent imaginary Because it cannot be discovered now Upon this fully apprehended planet? No more applicants considered, Alas, alas"...

item.title: it is at moments after I have dreamed
item.itunes:author: E. E. Cummings
item.itunes:summary:
it is at moments after I have dreamed by E. E. Cummings
" it is at moments after i have dreamed of the rare entertainment of your eyes, when(being fool to fancy)i have deemed with your peculiar mouth my heart made wise"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, E. E. Cummings
item.description:
it is at moments after I have dreamed by E. E. Cummings
" it is at moments after i have dreamed of the rare entertainment of your eyes, when(being fool to fancy)i have deemed with your peculiar mouth my heart made wise"...

item.title: Send Round the Hat
item.itunes:author: Henry Lawson
item.itunes:summary:
Send Round the Hat by Henry Lawson
"Now this is the creed from the Book of the Bush ? Should be simple and plain to a dunce"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Henry Lawson
item.description:
Send Round the Hat by Henry Lawson
"Now this is the creed from the Book of the Bush ? Should be simple and plain to a dunce"...

item.title: The Lower Room
item.itunes:author: Edith Nesbit
item.itunes:summary:
The Lower Room by Edith Nesbit
"How soft the lamplight falls On pictures, books, And pleasant coloured walls And curtains drawn"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Edith Nesbit
item.description:
The Lower Room by Edith Nesbit
"How soft the lamplight falls On pictures, books, And pleasant coloured walls And curtains drawn"...

item.title: The Ship Of Earth
item.itunes:author: Sidney Lanier
item.itunes:summary:
The Ship Of Earth. By Sidney Lanier
"Thou Ship of Earth, with Death, and Birth, and Life, and Sex aboard, And fires of Desires burning hotly in the hold"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Sidney Lanier
item.description:
The Ship Of Earth. By Sidney Lanier
"Thou Ship of Earth, with Death, and Birth, and Life, and Sex aboard, And fires of Desires burning hotly in the hold"...

item.title: Absence
item.itunes:author: Elizabeth Jennings
item.itunes:summary:
Absence by Elizabeth Jennings
"I visited the place where we last met. Nothing was changed, the gardens were well-tended, The fountains sprayed their usual steady jet; There was no sign that anything had ended And nothing to instruct me to forget"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Elizabeth Jennings
item.description:
Absence by Elizabeth Jennings
"I visited the place where we last met. Nothing was changed, the gardens were well-tended, The fountains sprayed their usual steady jet; There was no sign that anything had ended And nothing to instruct me to forget"...

item.title: On Looking for Models
item.itunes:author: Alan Dugan
item.itunes:summary:
On Looking for Models by Alan Dugan
"The trees in time have something else to do besides their treeing. What is it. I'm a starving to death man myself, and thirsty, thirsty by their fountains but I cannot drink their mud and sunlight to be whole"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Alan Dugan
item.description:
On Looking for Models by Alan Dugan
"The trees in time have something else to do besides their treeing. What is it. I'm a starving to death man myself, and thirsty, thirsty by their fountains but I cannot drink their mud and sunlight to be whole"...

item.title: In A Northern Wood
item.itunes:author: Katharine Lee Bates
item.itunes:summary:
In A Northern Wood by Katharine Lee Bates
"Fragrant are the cedar-boughs stretching green and level, Feasting-halls where waxwings flit at their spicy revel"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Katharine Lee Bates
item.description:
In A Northern Wood by Katharine Lee Bates
"Fragrant are the cedar-boughs stretching green and level, Feasting-halls where waxwings flit at their spicy revel"...

item.title: Freedom
item.itunes:author: Ambrose Bierce
item.itunes:summary:
Freedom by Ambrose Bierce
"Freedom, as every schoolboy knows, Once shrieked as Kosciusko fell; On every wind, indeed, that blows I hear her yell"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Ambrose Bierce
item.description:
Freedom by Ambrose Bierce
"Freedom, as every schoolboy knows, Once shrieked as Kosciusko fell; On every wind, indeed, that blows I hear her yell"...

item.title: A Map Of Love
item.itunes:author: Donald Justice
item.itunes:summary:
A Map Of Love by Donald Justice
"Your face more than others' faces Maps the half-remembered places I have come to I while I slept"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Donald Justice
item.description:
A Map Of Love by Donald Justice
"Your face more than others' faces Maps the half-remembered places I have come to I while I slept"...

item.title: If I Had Known
item.itunes:author: Alice Dunbar-Nelson
item.itunes:summary:
If I Had Known by Alice Dunbar-Nelson
"If I had known Two years ago how drear this life should be, And crowd upon itself all strangely sad, Mayhap another song would burst from out my lips"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Alice Dunbar-Nelson
item.description:
If I Had Known by Alice Dunbar-Nelson
"If I had known Two years ago how drear this life should be, And crowd upon itself all strangely sad, Mayhap another song would burst from out my lips"...

item.title: The Columbine
item.itunes:author: Michael Earls
item.itunes:summary:
The Columbine by Michael Earls
"Gray lonely rocks about thee stand, Ignored of sun and dew, Yet is thy breath upon the land, To thy vocation true"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Michael Earls
item.description:
The Columbine by Michael Earls
"Gray lonely rocks about thee stand, Ignored of sun and dew, Yet is thy breath upon the land, To thy vocation true"...

item.title: More Than Myself
item.itunes:author: Anne Sexton
item.itunes:summary:
More Than Myself by Anne Sexton
"Not that it was beautiful, but that, in the end, there was a certain sense of order there"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Anne Sexton
item.description:
More Than Myself by Anne Sexton
"Not that it was beautiful, but that, in the end, there was a certain sense of order there"...

item.title: A Spell Before Winter
item.itunes:author: Howard Nemerov
item.itunes:summary:
A Spell Before Winter by Howard Nemerov
"After the red leaf and the gold have gone, Brought down by the wind, then by hammering rain"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Howard Nemerov
item.description:
A Spell Before Winter by Howard Nemerov
"After the red leaf and the gold have gone, Brought down by the wind, then by hammering rain"...

item.title: Aunt Jennifer's Tigers
item.itunes:author: Adrienne Rich
item.itunes:summary:
Aunt Jennifer's Tigers by Adrienne Rich
"Aunt Jennifer?s tigers prance across a screen,? Bright topaz denizens of a world of green"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Adrienne Rich
item.description:
Aunt Jennifer's Tigers by Adrienne Rich
"Aunt Jennifer?s tigers prance across a screen,? Bright topaz denizens of a world of green"...

item.title: The Sloth
item.itunes:author: Theodore Roethke
item.itunes:summary:
The Sloth by Theodore Roethke
"In moving-slow he has no Peer. You ask him something in his Ear, He thinks about it for a Year"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Theodore Roethke
item.description:
The Sloth by Theodore Roethke
"In moving-slow he has no Peer. You ask him something in his Ear, He thinks about it for a Year"...

item.title: The Pond At Dusk
item.itunes:author: Jane Kenyon
item.itunes:summary:
The Pond At Dusk by Jane Kenyon
"A fly wounds the water but the wound soon heals. Swallows tilt and twitter overhead, dropping now and then toward the outward-radiating evidence of food"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Jane Kenyon
item.description:
The Pond At Dusk by Jane Kenyon
"A fly wounds the water but the wound soon heals. Swallows tilt and twitter overhead, dropping now and then toward the outward-radiating evidence of food"...

item.title: Come My Cantilations
item.itunes:author: Ezra Pound
item.itunes:summary:
Come My Cantilations by Ezra Pound
"Come my cantilations, Let us dump our hatreds into one bunch and be done with them"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Ezra Pound
item.description:
Come My Cantilations by Ezra Pound
"Come my cantilations, Let us dump our hatreds into one bunch and be done with them"...

item.title: One Worse Thing
item.itunes:author: Margaret Widdemer
item.itunes:summary:
One Worse Thing by Margaret Widdemer
"Last Spring I walked these ways, and a sharp grief walked with me, For you had broken my heart with a light kiss, carelessly"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Margaret Widdemer
item.description:
One Worse Thing by Margaret Widdemer
"Last Spring I walked these ways, and a sharp grief walked with me, For you had broken my heart with a light kiss, carelessly"...

item.title: Forth went the candid man
item.itunes:author: Stephen Crane
item.itunes:summary:
Forth went the candid man by Stephen Crane
"Forth went the candid man And spoke freely to the wind -- When he looked about him he was in a far strange country"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Stephen Crane
item.description:
Forth went the candid man by Stephen Crane
"Forth went the candid man And spoke freely to the wind -- When he looked about him he was in a far strange country"...

item.title: Harvest
item.itunes:author: Kathleen Raine
item.itunes:summary:
Harvest by Kathleen Raine
"Day is the hero's shield, Achilles' field, The light days are the angels. We the seed"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Kathleen Raine
item.description:
Harvest by Kathleen Raine
"Day is the hero's shield, Achilles' field, The light days are the angels. We the seed"...

item.title: Fear Is What Quickens Me
item.itunes:author: James Wright
item.itunes:summary:
Fear Is What Quickens Me by James Wright
"Many animals that our fathers killed in America Had quick eyes. They stared about wildly, When the moon went dark"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, James Wright
item.description:
Fear Is What Quickens Me by James Wright
"Many animals that our fathers killed in America Had quick eyes. They stared about wildly, When the moon went dark"...

item.title: Dream Land
item.itunes:author: Christina Rossetti
item.itunes:summary:
Dream Land by Christina Rossetti
"Where sunless rivers weep Their waves into the deep, She sleeps a charmed sleep: Awake her not. Led by a single star, She came from very far To seek where shadows are Her pleasant lot"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Christina Rossetti
item.description:
Dream Land by Christina Rossetti
"Where sunless rivers weep Their waves into the deep, She sleeps a charmed sleep: Awake her not. Led by a single star, She came from very far To seek where shadows are Her pleasant lot"...

item.title: Out Of The Night That Covers Me
item.itunes:author: William Ernest Henley
item.itunes:summary:
Out Of The Night That Covers Me By William Ernest Henley
"Out of the night that covers me, Black as the Pit from pole to pole, I thank whatever gods may be For my unconquerable soul"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, William Ernest Henley
item.description:
Out Of The Night That Covers Me By William Ernest Henley
"Out of the night that covers me, Black as the Pit from pole to pole, I thank whatever gods may be For my unconquerable soul"...

item.title: A Wounded Deer
item.itunes:author: Emily Dickinson
item.itunes:summary:
A Wounded Deer by Emily Dickinson
"A Wounded Deer ? leaps highest ? I've heard the Hunter tell ? 'Tis but the Ecstasy of death ? And then the Brake is still"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Emily Dickinson
item.description:
A Wounded Deer by Emily Dickinson
"A Wounded Deer ? leaps highest ? I've heard the Hunter tell ? 'Tis but the Ecstasy of death ? And then the Brake is still"...

item.title: When First We Faced, And Touching Showed
item.itunes:author: Philip Larkin
item.itunes:summary:
When First We Faced, And Touching Showed by Philip Larkin
"When first we faced, and touching showed How well we knew the early moves"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Philip Larkin
item.description:
When First We Faced, And Touching Showed by Philip Larkin
"When first we faced, and touching showed How well we knew the early moves"...

item.title: Late Evening Song
item.itunes:author: Weldon Kees
item.itunes:summary:
Late Evening Song by Weldon Kees
"For a while Let it be enough: The responsive smile, Though effort goes into it"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Weldon Kees
item.description:
Late Evening Song by Weldon Kees
"For a while Let it be enough: The responsive smile, Though effort goes into it"...

item.title: Happiness
item.itunes:author: Carl Sandburg
item.itunes:summary:
Happiness by Carl Sandburg
"I asked the professors who teach the meaning of life to tell me what is happiness. And I went to famous executives who boss the work of thousands of men. They all shook their heads and gave me a smile as though I was trying to fool with them"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Carl Sandburg
item.description:
Happiness by Carl Sandburg
"I asked the professors who teach the meaning of life to tell me what is happiness. And I went to famous executives who boss the work of thousands of men. They all shook their heads and gave me a smile as though I was trying to fool with them"...

item.title: Nahant
item.itunes:author: Sara Teasdale
item.itunes:summary:
Nahant by Sara Teasdale
"Bowed as an elm under the weight of its beauty, So earth is bowed, under her weight of splendor"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Sara Teasdale
item.description:
Nahant by Sara Teasdale
"Bowed as an elm under the weight of its beauty, So earth is bowed, under her weight of splendor"...

item.title: Losing Track
item.itunes:author: Denise Levertov
item.itunes:summary:
Losing Track by Denise Levertov
"Long after you have swung back away from me I think you are still with me"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Denise Levertov
item.description:
Losing Track by Denise Levertov
"Long after you have swung back away from me I think you are still with me"...

item.title: The Hope Of The Resurrection
item.itunes:author: Vachel Lindsay
item.itunes:summary:
The Hope Of The Resurrection by Vachel Lindsay
"Though I have watched so many mourners weep O'er the real dead, in dull earth laid asleep? Those dead seemed but the shadows of my days"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Vachel Lindsay
item.description:
The Hope Of The Resurrection by Vachel Lindsay
"Though I have watched so many mourners weep O'er the real dead, in dull earth laid asleep? Those dead seemed but the shadows of my days"...

item.title: Creed
item.itunes:author: Gabriela Mistral
item.itunes:summary:
Creed by Gabriela Mistral
"I believe in my heart that when The wounded heart sunk within the depth of God sings It rises from the pond alive As if new-born"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Gabriela Mistral
item.description:
Creed by Gabriela Mistral
"I believe in my heart that when The wounded heart sunk within the depth of God sings It rises from the pond alive As if new-born"...

item.title: The Night In Isla Negra
item.itunes:author: Pablo Neruda
item.itunes:summary:
The Night In Isla Negra by Pablo Neruda
"Ancient night and the unruly salt beat at the walls of my house. The shadow is all one, the sky throbs now along with the ocean"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Pablo Neruda
item.description:
The Night In Isla Negra by Pablo Neruda
"Ancient night and the unruly salt beat at the walls of my house. The shadow is all one, the sky throbs now along with the ocean"...

item.title: When I'm Killed
item.itunes:author: Robert Graves
item.itunes:summary:
When I'm Killed by Robert Graves
"When I?m killed, don?t think of me Buried there in Cambrin Wood, Nor as in Zion think of me With the Intolerable Good"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Robert Graves
item.description:
When I'm Killed by Robert Graves
"When I?m killed, don?t think of me Buried there in Cambrin Wood, Nor as in Zion think of me With the Intolerable Good"...

item.title: There Is Pleasure In The Pathless Woods
item.itunes:author: Lord Byron
item.itunes:summary:
There Is Pleasure In The Pathless Woods by Lord Byron
"There is a pleasure in the pathless woods, There is a rapture on the lonely shore, There is society, where none intrudes, By the deep sea, and music in its roar"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Lord Byron
item.description:
There Is Pleasure In The Pathless Woods by Lord Byron
"There is a pleasure in the pathless woods, There is a rapture on the lonely shore, There is society, where none intrudes, By the deep sea, and music in its roar"...

item.title: The Enemies
item.itunes:author: Elizabeth Jennings
item.itunes:summary:
The Enemies by Elizabeth Jennings
"Last night they came across the river and Entered the city. Women were awake With lights and food. They entertained the band, Not asking what the men had come to take"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Elizabeth Jennings
item.description:
The Enemies by Elizabeth Jennings
"Last night they came across the river and Entered the city. Women were awake With lights and food. They entertained the band, Not asking what the men had come to take"...

item.title: When I Was One-and-Twenty
item.itunes:author: A. E. Housman
item.itunes:summary:
When I Was One-and-Twenty by A. E. Housman
"When I was one-and-twenty I heard a wise man say, "Give crowns and pounds and guineas But not your heart away"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, A. E. Housman
item.description:
When I Was One-and-Twenty by A. E. Housman
"When I was one-and-twenty I heard a wise man say, "Give crowns and pounds and guineas But not your heart away"...

item.title: Five Flights Up
item.itunes:author: Elizabeth Bishop
item.itunes:summary:
Five Flights Up by Elizabeth Bishop
"Still dark. The unknown bird sits on his usual branch. The little dog next door barks in his sleep inquiringly, just once"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Elizabeth Bishop
item.description:
Five Flights Up by Elizabeth Bishop
"Still dark. The unknown bird sits on his usual branch. The little dog next door barks in his sleep inquiringly, just once"...

item.title: In the Trenches
item.itunes:author: Isaac Rosenberg
item.itunes:summary:
In the Trenches by Isaac Rosenberg
"I snatched two poppies From the parapet?s ledge, Two bright red poppies That winked on the ledge"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Isaac Rosenberg
item.description:
In the Trenches by Isaac Rosenberg
"I snatched two poppies From the parapet?s ledge, Two bright red poppies That winked on the ledge"...

item.title: The Night I Was Going To Die
item.itunes:author: Charles Bukowski
item.itunes:summary:
The Night I Was Going To Die by Charles Bukowski
"the night I was going to die I was sweating on the bed and I could hear the crickets and there was a cat fight outside"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Charles Bukowski
item.description:
The Night I Was Going To Die by Charles Bukowski
"the night I was going to die I was sweating on the bed and I could hear the crickets and there was a cat fight outside"...

item.title: The Alchemist
item.itunes:author: Louise Bogan
item.itunes:summary:
The Alchemist by Louise Bogan
"I burned my life, that I may find A passion wholly of the mind, Thought divorced from eye and bone Ecstasy come to breath alone"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Louise Bogan
item.description:
The Alchemist by Louise Bogan
"I burned my life, that I may find A passion wholly of the mind, Thought divorced from eye and bone Ecstasy come to breath alone"...

item.title: A Lady Who Thinks She Is Thirty
item.itunes:author: Ogden Nash
item.itunes:summary:
A Lady Who Thinks She Is Thirty by Ogden Nash
"Unwillingly Miranda wakes, Feels the sun with terror, One unwilling step she takes, Shuddering to the mirror"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Ogden Nash
item.description:
A Lady Who Thinks She Is Thirty by Ogden Nash
"Unwillingly Miranda wakes, Feels the sun with terror, One unwilling step she takes, Shuddering to the mirror"...

item.title: A Fallen Leaf
item.itunes:author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox
item.itunes:summary:
A Fallen Leaf by Ella Wheeler Wilcox
"A trusting little leaf of green, A bold audacious frost; A rendezvous, a kiss or two, And youth for ever lost"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Ella Wheeler Wilcox
item.description:
A Fallen Leaf by Ella Wheeler Wilcox
"A trusting little leaf of green, A bold audacious frost; A rendezvous, a kiss or two, And youth for ever lost"...

item.title: Tree At My Window
item.itunes:author: Robert Frost
item.itunes:summary:
Tree At My Window by Robert Frost
"Tree at my window, window tree, My sash is lowered when night comes on; But let there never be curtain drawn Between you and me"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Robert Frost
item.description:
Tree At My Window by Robert Frost
"Tree at my window, window tree, My sash is lowered when night comes on; But let there never be curtain drawn Between you and me"...

item.title: The Village Green
item.itunes:author: Jane Taylor
item.itunes:summary:
The Village Green by Jane Taylor
"Skirted round with houses small, All the boys and girls are seen, Playing there with hoop and ball"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Jane Taylor
item.description:
The Village Green by Jane Taylor
"Skirted round with houses small, All the boys and girls are seen, Playing there with hoop and ball"...

item.title: Liberty
item.itunes:author: Archibald MacLeish
item.itunes:summary:
Liberty by Archibald MacLeish
"When liberty is headlong girl And runs her roads and wends her ways Liberty will shriek and whirl Her showery torch to see it blaze"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Archibald MacLeish
item.description:
Liberty by Archibald MacLeish
"When liberty is headlong girl And runs her roads and wends her ways Liberty will shriek and whirl Her showery torch to see it blaze"...

item.title: My Kingdom
item.itunes:author: Louisa May Alcott
item.itunes:summary:
My Kingdom by Louisa May Alcott
"A little kingdom I possess where thoughts and feelings dwell, And very hard I find the task of governing it well"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Louisa May Alcott
item.description:
My Kingdom by Louisa May Alcott
"A little kingdom I possess where thoughts and feelings dwell, And very hard I find the task of governing it well"...

item.title: Nantucket
item.itunes:author: William Carlos Williams
item.itunes:summary:
Nantucket by William Carlos Williams
"Flowers through the window lavender and yellow
changed by white curtains? Smell of cleanliness"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, William Carlos Williams
item.description:
Nantucket by William Carlos Williams
"Flowers through the window lavender and yellow
changed by white curtains? Smell of cleanliness"...

item.title: The Balance Wheel
item.itunes:author: Anne Sexton
item.itunes:summary:
The Balance Wheel by Anne Sexton
"Where I waved at the sky And waited your love through a February sleep, I saw birds swinging in, watched them multiply"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Anne Sexton
item.description:
The Balance Wheel by Anne Sexton
"Where I waved at the sky And waited your love through a February sleep, I saw birds swinging in, watched them multiply"...

item.title: Continual Conversation With A Silent Man
item.itunes:author: Wallace Stevens
item.itunes:summary:
Continual Conversation With A Silent Man by Wallace Stevens
"The old brown hen and the old blue sky, Between the two we live and die-- The broken cartwheel on the hill"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Wallace Stevens
item.description:
Continual Conversation With A Silent Man by Wallace Stevens
"The old brown hen and the old blue sky, Between the two we live and die-- The broken cartwheel on the hill"...

item.title: The Uncertainty Of Happiness
item.itunes:author: Susannah Hawkins
item.itunes:summary:
The Uncertainty Of Happiness by Susannah Hawkins
"O! I have seen the morning sun, Adorn the rising day; Then I have seen a dark'ning cloud O'ershed his golden ray"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Susannah Hawkins
item.description:
The Uncertainty Of Happiness by Susannah Hawkins
"O! I have seen the morning sun, Adorn the rising day; Then I have seen a dark'ning cloud O'ershed his golden ray"...

item.title: A Fickle Woman
item.itunes:author: Eugene Field
item.itunes:summary:
A Fickle Woman by Eugene Field
"Her nature is the sea's, that smiles to-night A radiant maiden in the moon's soft light"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Eugene Field
item.description:
A Fickle Woman by Eugene Field
"Her nature is the sea's, that smiles to-night A radiant maiden in the moon's soft light"...

item.title: Love And The Butterfly
item.itunes:author: Alice Dunbar-Nelson
item.itunes:summary:
Love And The Butterfly By Alice Dunbar-Nelson
"I heard a merry voice one day And glancing at my side, Fair Love, all breathless, flushed with play, A butterfly did ride"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Alice Dunbar-Nelson
item.description:
Love And The Butterfly By Alice Dunbar-Nelson
"I heard a merry voice one day And glancing at my side, Fair Love, all breathless, flushed with play, A butterfly did ride"...

item.title: Traveling Through The Dark
item.itunes:author: William Stafford
item.itunes:summary:
Traveling Through The Dark by William Stafford
"Traveling through the dark I found a deer dead on the edge of the Wilson River road. It is usually best to roll them into the canyon: that road is narrow; to swerve might make more dead"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, William Stafford
item.description:
Traveling Through The Dark by William Stafford
"Traveling through the dark I found a deer dead on the edge of the Wilson River road. It is usually best to roll them into the canyon: that road is narrow; to swerve might make more dead"...

item.title: To You
item.itunes:author: Walt Whitman
item.itunes:summary:
To You. by Walt Whitman
"Let us twain walk aside from the rest; Now we are together privately, do you discard ceremony, Come! vouchsafe to me what has yet been vouchsafed to none?Tell me the whole story, Tell me what you would not tell your brother, wife, husband, or physician."
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Walt Whitman
item.description:
To You. by Walt Whitman
"Let us twain walk aside from the rest; Now we are together privately, do you discard ceremony, Come! vouchsafe to me what has yet been vouchsafed to none?Tell me the whole story, Tell me what you would not tell your brother, wife, husband, or physician."

item.title: My Youth
item.itunes:author: William Henry Davies
item.itunes:summary:
My Youth by William Henry Davies
"My youth was my old age, Weary and long; It had too many cares To think of song"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, William Henry Davies
item.description:
My Youth by William Henry Davies
"My youth was my old age, Weary and long; It had too many cares To think of song"...

item.title: A Little Boy's Dream
item.itunes:author: Katherine Mansfield
item.itunes:summary:
A Little Boy's Dream by Katherine Mansfield
"To and fro, to and fro In my little boat I go Sailing far across the sea All alone, just little me. And the sea is big and strong And the journey very long"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Katherine Mansfield
item.description:
A Little Boy's Dream by Katherine Mansfield
"To and fro, to and fro In my little boat I go Sailing far across the sea All alone, just little me. And the sea is big and strong And the journey very long"...

item.title: As I Grew Older
item.itunes:author: Langston Hughes
item.itunes:summary:
As I Grew Older by Langston Hughes
"It was a long time ago. I have almost forgotten my dream. But it was there then, In front of me, Bright like a sun? My dream"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Langston Hughes
item.description:
As I Grew Older by Langston Hughes
"It was a long time ago. I have almost forgotten my dream. But it was there then, In front of me, Bright like a sun? My dream"...

item.title: Who Said That Love Was Fire?
item.itunes:author: Patience Worth
item.itunes:summary:
Who Said That Love Was Fire? By Patience Worth
"Who said that love was fire? I know that love is ash. It is the thing which remains When the fire is spent, The holy essence of experience."
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Patience Worth
item.description:
Who Said That Love Was Fire? By Patience Worth
"Who said that love was fire? I know that love is ash. It is the thing which remains When the fire is spent, The holy essence of experience."

item.title: Vision
item.itunes:author: Aldous Huxley
item.itunes:summary:
Vision by Aldous Huxley
"I had been sitting alone with books, Till doubt was a black disease, When I heard the cheerful shout of rooks In the bare, prophetic trees"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Aldous Huxley
item.description:
Vision by Aldous Huxley
"I had been sitting alone with books, Till doubt was a black disease, When I heard the cheerful shout of rooks In the bare, prophetic trees"...

item.title: Interior
item.itunes:author: Hart Crane
item.itunes:summary:
Interior by Hart Crane
"It sheds a shy solemnity, This lamp in our poor room. O grey and gold amenity, -- Silence and gentle gloom"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Hart Crane
item.description:
Interior by Hart Crane
"It sheds a shy solemnity, This lamp in our poor room. O grey and gold amenity, -- Silence and gentle gloom"...

item.title: The Reason
item.itunes:author: Stevie Smith
item.itunes:summary:
The Reason by Stevie Smith
"My life is vile I hate it so I'll wait awhile And then I'll go"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Stevie Smith
item.description:
The Reason by Stevie Smith
"My life is vile I hate it so I'll wait awhile And then I'll go"...

item.title: A Worshipper
item.itunes:author: Cicely Fox Smith
item.itunes:summary:
A Worshipper by Cicely Fox Smith
"Against the oaken pew he leant, A child of summers three or four, And smiled to see each stained-glass saint Cast by the sunlight on the floor"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Cicely Fox Smith
item.description:
A Worshipper by Cicely Fox Smith
"Against the oaken pew he leant, A child of summers three or four, And smiled to see each stained-glass saint Cast by the sunlight on the floor"...

item.title: The Voice
item.itunes:author: Thomas Hardy
item.itunes:summary:
The Voice by Thomas Hardy
"Woman much missed, how you call to me, call to me, Saying that now you are not as you were When you had changed from the one who was all to me, But as at first, when our day was fair"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Thomas Hardy
item.description:
The Voice by Thomas Hardy
"Woman much missed, how you call to me, call to me, Saying that now you are not as you were When you had changed from the one who was all to me, But as at first, when our day was fair"...

item.title: New-Born
item.itunes:author: Harriet Monroe
item.itunes:summary:
New-Born by Harriet Monroe
"She is so wee, So wise and dear Her eyes can see, Her ears can hear, The flowers that grow Below the snow"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Harriet Monroe
item.description:
New-Born by Harriet Monroe
"She is so wee, So wise and dear Her eyes can see, Her ears can hear, The flowers that grow Below the snow"...

item.title: Minuscule Things
item.itunes:author: William Matthews
item.itunes:summary:
Minuscule Things by William Matthews
"There?s a crack in this glass so fine we can?t see it, and in the blue eye of the candleflame?s needle"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, William Matthews
item.description:
Minuscule Things by William Matthews
"There?s a crack in this glass so fine we can?t see it, and in the blue eye of the candleflame?s needle"...

item.title: Otherwise
item.itunes:author: Jane Kenyon
item.itunes:summary:
Otherwise by Jane Kenyon
"I got out of bed on two strong legs. It might have been otherwise"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Jane Kenyon
item.description:
Otherwise by Jane Kenyon
"I got out of bed on two strong legs. It might have been otherwise"...

item.title: Give Me a Doctor
item.itunes:author: W. H. Auden
item.itunes:summary:
Give Me a Doctor by W. H. Auden
"Give me a doctor partridge-plump, Short in the leg and broad in the rump, An endomorph with gentle hands Who'll never make absurd demands That I abandon all my vices"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, W. H. Auden
item.description:
Give Me a Doctor by W. H. Auden
"Give me a doctor partridge-plump, Short in the leg and broad in the rump, An endomorph with gentle hands Who'll never make absurd demands That I abandon all my vices"...

item.title: This Morning
item.itunes:author: Raymond Carver
item.itunes:summary:
This Morning by Raymond Carver
"This morning was something. A little snow lay on the ground. The sun floated in a clear blue sky. The sea was blue, and blue-green, as far as the eye could see"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Raymond Carver
item.description:
This Morning by Raymond Carver
"This morning was something. A little snow lay on the ground. The sun floated in a clear blue sky. The sea was blue, and blue-green, as far as the eye could see"...

item.title: The Reward
item.itunes:author: James Weldon Johnson
item.itunes:summary:
The Reward by James Weldon Johnson
"No greater earthly boon than this I crave, That those who some day gather 'round my grave"
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, James Weldon Johnson
item.description:
The Reward by James Weldon Johnson
"No greater earthly boon than this I crave, That those who some day gather 'round my grave"

item.title: Petals
item.itunes:author: Amy Lowell
item.itunes:summary:
Petals by Amy Lowell
"Life is a stream On which we strew Petal by petal the flower of our heart; The end lost in dream, They float past our view, We only watch their glad, early start"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Amy Lowell
item.description:
Petals by Amy Lowell
"Life is a stream On which we strew Petal by petal the flower of our heart; The end lost in dream, They float past our view, We only watch their glad, early start"...

item.title: Homes
item.itunes:author: Margaret Widdemer
item.itunes:summary:
Homes by Margaret Widdemer
"The lamplight's shaded rose On couch and chair and wall, The drowsy book let fall, The children's heads, bent close"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Margaret Widdemer
item.description:
Homes by Margaret Widdemer
"The lamplight's shaded rose On couch and chair and wall, The drowsy book let fall, The children's heads, bent close"...

item.title: Poetic Eggs
item.itunes:author: Ezra Pound
item.itunes:summary:
Poetic Eggs by Ezra Pound
"I am a grave poetic hen That lays poetic eggs And to enhance my temperament A little quiet begs"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Ezra Pound
item.description:
Poetic Eggs by Ezra Pound
"I am a grave poetic hen That lays poetic eggs And to enhance my temperament A little quiet begs"...

item.title: Fall of the Evening Star
item.itunes:author: Kenneth Patchen
item.itunes:summary:
Fall of the Evening Star by Kenneth Patchen
"Speak softly; sun going down Out of sight. Come near me now"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Kenneth Patchen
item.description:
Fall of the Evening Star by Kenneth Patchen
"Speak softly; sun going down Out of sight. Come near me now"...

item.title: Does It Pay?
item.itunes:author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox
item.itunes:summary:
Does It Pay? by Ella Wheeler Wilcox
"If one poor burdened toiler o?er life?s road, Who meets us by the way, Goes on less conscious of his galling load, Then life, indeed, does pay"...
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Ella Wheeler Wilcox
item.description:
Does It Pay? by Ella Wheeler Wilcox
"If one poor burdened toiler o?er life?s road, Who meets us by the way, Goes on less conscious of his galling load, Then life, indeed, does pay"...

item.title: Those Two
item.itunes:author: Allen Ginsberg
item.itunes:summary:
Those Two by Allen Ginsberg
'That tree said I don't like that white car under me, it smells gasoline That other tree next to it said O you're always complaining you're a neurotic you can see by the way you're bent over."
item.itunes:keywords: poems, poets, poetry, daily poem, Allen Ginsberg
item.description:
Those Two by Allen Ginsberg
'That tree said I don't like that white car under me, it smells gasoline That other tree next to it said O you're always complaining you're a neurotic you can see by the way you're bent over."
